definitions.title: n.pr.div.
definitions.body: Molech (LXX Molox, Vulgate Moloch) (= [[מֶלֶח]] i.e. (divine) King, with vowels of [[בּשֶׁת]] to denote abhorrence, Hoffm:ZAW iii. 1883, 124 RS:Sem. i. 353; 2nd ed. 372; cf. Hoffm:GG Abh. xxxvi. 1890 (May, 1889), 25; Ph. n. pr. div. [[מלך]] Milk, in n. pr. cf. Bloch, Dr:De 222 f.);—c. art. ´[[הַמּ]]:—the god to whom Isr. sacrif. children with fire (in valley of Hinnom); ´[[העביר בָּנֵשׁ לַ מּ]] 2Ki 23:10; ´[[העביר לַמּ]] Je 32:35 (‖[[הַבַּעַל]]), Le 18:21 (H); ´[[נתן לַמּ]] Le 20:2, Le 20:3, Le 20:4 (H); more gen. ´[[לִזְנוֹת אַחֲרֵי הַמּ]] v:Le 20:5 (H). In 1Ki 11:7 rd. prob. [[מִלְכּׂם]], q. v.
